document_title: Joint stiffness: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Why do I have stiffness in the morning/after waking up?
Joint stiffness is common in older people in the morning or after waking up with symptoms of numbness, stiffness, and limited joint movement. The condition can last for 15 - 20 minutes before the patient can move again. There are many causes of this condition, including bone and joint disease, injury or important mineral deficiencies.
When to see a doctor?
You should see a doctor immediately if you have constant pain, even when resting at night, or limited mobility in the painful area. The constitution and pathology may be different in many people. Discuss with your doctor to find the best treatment solution.
Does joint stiffness require surgery?
There are many types of joint stiffness, so you need to see a doctor to find out the cause, and then have appropriate treatment depending on the level of stiffness. If you do not know the cause, you should immediately see a rheumatology or general internal medicine specialist.
Many people with this disease will be prescribed anti-inflammatory painkillers by doctors depending on the severity. In addition, you can practice physical therapy to speed up joint recovery, increase the flexibility of joint cartilage and the elasticity of ligaments.
Whether joint stiffness requires surgery depends on the severity, prognosis, and cause of the disease. When there are signs of stiff joints, patients should go to a medical facility with good specialists and modern facilities to be diagnosed and given accurate and timely treatment.
